wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant General Sir Lawrence Worthington Parsons  (23 March 1850 – 20 August 1923) was a British Army officer who became General Officer Commanding 6th Division.

response: Promoted major general, Hickie took over from Lieutenant General Sir Lawrence Parsons. Hickie – one of a rare breed, a senior, Irish, Catholic officer – was a popular replacement. It was politically a highly sensitive appointment which required the professionalism and political awareness Hickie fortunately possessed as the division was formed around a core of Irish National Volunteers in response to Carson's Ulster Volunteers. He was much more diplomatic and tactful than his predecessors and spoke of the pride which his new command gave him,Irish Regiments in the Great War p. 119, Timothy Bowmann (2003)  but did not hesitate to make sweeping changes amongst the senior officers of the Irish Division. After putting the division through intensive training, it left under Irish command of which each man took personal pride. It arrived in December 1915.
Laurence or Lawrence Parsons may refer to:
* Lawrence Parsons, 2nd Earl of Rosse (1758–1841), Irish peer
* Lawrence Parsons, 4th Earl of Rosse (1840–1908), Irish peer
* Lawrence Parsons (British Army officer) (1850–1923), British general
*Lawrence Parsons (British Army officer) (1850–1923), British Army lieutenant general
